p.s: In this given extract of Disgraced, Scene 3 Amir, the main protagonist, plays a main and influential role in the scene.
Amir KhapoorKapoor is a pakistaniPakistani man who has been angried to Emily for a long time, and has been having some trouble with his religious and foreign background.
These factors play a major role in the extract and have a lot of connections with his character.
The conflict situation where Amir has been brought into revealed a strong anger that build itself up in Amir (p. 71, ll. 26-31).
His anger is partially seen in his languaglanguage and tone.
Amir is an unconscious and insecure character and is oftenly not sure how to respond to different situations.
His unconsciousness and insecurity is seen when he blames the rather not guilty character Jory and connects his work and foreign background with his confrontation (p. 72, ll. 22-28).
His religious and foreign background connected with his work life had been bothering Amir since his early days and resulted in him having an inner conflict.
Amir is also presented as a stressed and violent character who cannot handle himself in this state of emotion (p. 72, l. 17 vicious, p. 71, l. 22 inflamed).
His struggle of handling negative emotions is also seen in his actions (p. 72, l. 40).
Him spitting in IssacsIsaac's face reveals the bad connection between his emotions and his background wichwhich overcomes him in unpleasentunpleasant situations.
AAn anger factor for this is his childhood and his more or less trauma he experienced where his mother spat in his face when bringing unpleasentunpleasant news.
The beating of his wife proves that he shows his vulnerability rather through violence than through words (p. 73, l. 26, p. 74, l. 5).
Amircan notcannot find words and him being fueled by anger deliveresdelivers actions that he rather regrets (p. 74, l. 15).
The detailed analysis shows that Amir KhapoorKapoor is emotionally unstable and in ana major inner conflict which bothers him daily.
He hasn't found his identity and place in his life and is escaping from facing his truth.
